metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6553 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The CUPS AppArmor profile incorrectly confined the dnssd backend due to use of hard links. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to escape confinement. This flaw affects versions prior to 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1 in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, prior to 2.2.4-7ubuntu3.1 in Ubuntu 17.10, prior to 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5 in Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, and prior to 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.10 in Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6553` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
cups-bsd - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
cups-client - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
cups-common - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
cups-core-drivers - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
cups-daemon - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
cups-ipp-utils - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
cups-ppdc - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
cups-server-common - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
libcups2 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
libcupscgi1 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
libcupsimage2 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
libcupsmime1 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
libcupsppdc1 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5').
